snippet: Mets pitcher Matt Harvey has decided to try to rehabilitate his partly torn ulnar collateral ligament, then attempt to throw, rather than undergo surgery right away.
abstract: New York Mets pitcher Matt Harvey decides to undergo six-to-eight-week rehabilitation for partly torn ulnar collateral ligament, rather than undergo surgery that would keep him out for more than year; acknowledges that surgery may be necessary if pain continues after rehabilitation.
lead_paragraph: Mets pitcher Matt Harvey has decided to try to rehabilitate his partly torn ulnar collateral ligament, then attempt to throw, rather than undergo surgery right away.

headline.main: Harvey Will Put Off Surgery, at Least for Now
headline.print_headline: Harvey Will Put Off Surgery, at Least for Now
